title: Re: keen art
content:
To say it blunt I think this is a waste of paint.

This painting seems to be big, I really wonder why because it lacks any kind of detail so it would have looked better in smaller size. The limited use of only three colours doesn't make it look better. There is also no excitement whatsoever in the way you drawned the paint making it all look very flat. The black lines are equel in size and are poorly drawn making the eyes lose their depth. It's also sad that the bounder is drawn over from the original sprite.

Other people seem to like it and that's fine but I'm not going to praise someone for something were so little effort was put in. -----------------
[img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/s/jcw/img/logo_jamster_navi.gif[/img][img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/storage/view/335/0/cr/CrazyFrog___Axel_F_Falling.gif[/img]

title: Re: keen art
content:
Oohh, nice! That is one classy slug. The comic-style shading, and the exaggerated texturing of the colours really makes it work.

I also like the bounder, despite Djaser's comments. 'Tis not the greatest art ever created, but it jumps out as "BOUNDER!" and that's all that matters--art doesn't have to be perfect or complex.

title: Re: keen art
content:
An excellent slug! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

title: ePod
content:
Excellent! The outline is great, and the shading is far more consistent than the slug's. The two-tone shading rocks. Though the brush texture in the green seems a bit less intentional than the slug, and in some places missing (ie. the dope-right side of the face and the dope-left next to the mouth).

I wonder about the necessity of those extra dots next to the teeth. It looks like a remnant of 4-bit dithering.

Overall, applaudable work.
